comments.body: Unfortunately this does not work beacuase of the nested options: https://select2.org/configuration/defaults#nested-options.

My change applies to the `v3/` dir, i.e. the v3.x branch.
In particular, this is documented here (unfortunately no document anchors, however it is the last paragraph in the page):

http://select2.github.io/select2/

> Select2 exposes its default options via the `$.fn.select2.defaults` object. Properties changed in this object (same properties configurable through the constructor) will take effect for every instance created after the change.

Note the wording _same properties configurable through the constructor_ which is why I assumed it'd be safe to use `Select2Options`.
